data.title: Idea: Screenshot
data.body: Many games support make screenshot in their game, so I think OpenRA should do too. And It is convenient  if OpenRA has screenshot(Players can share their game play with their friends and developers can post the bug screenshot easily)

data.title: Lua script augmentable Hacky AI
data.body:
This PR could start addressing these issues:

Lua scriptable AI #4947
AI base Planing #6696
Create low-level generic mission AI in LUA #11187

I made a Lua script so that...
0. Hacky AI still works without any Lua script as it did before for mods in develpoment.
1. AI can be developed as if it were making maps with a lot of triggers.
2. BaseBuilder part of the HackyAI to query the Lua script what to build next. This implements build orders. I made 4 for Soviets and Allies. When all BO is built, HackyAI builds what ever it likes by falling back to Hacky behavior. If carefully scripted, it can pause builds too! (Not implemented)
3. At each Tick() of the HackyAI, it also Ticks Lua script's Tick(), which controls the unit production. I made a basic implementation of team, task, taskforce (units that do the actions). Current Lua script will build any team it can build in Random. (It does rebuild MCV or build harvesters, siege weapons based on conditions though). By default, teams have no task specified. In this case, HackyAI will take control of it and do hacky movements with it.
4. I have a working team that does specified actions. (APC+2 flamer load then attack proc demo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yTzaKHBBzFE&feature=youtu.be) Currently, this is the only one with complex task as a proof of concept.
5. Even at this point it starts to feel like AI development in RA2 :)
6. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s_c_LWUK_iQ&feature=youtu.be : See demo of a full game

WIth this PR, modders can control what AI will build in what order and in what condition, what they will do. This will satisfy a lot of modders.

Oh yeah, forgot mention. I want to know how to expose information specified in HackyAIInfo to Lua script. Currently, some things, such as detecting enemy base defenses have hard coded actor names in the Lua script.

data.title: Add logic for graduating radius range
data.body:
It would be helpful to have logic that allows a radius to increase or decrease per set time. 
My idea in particular has to do with RA balance. I’d like to look at giving MCV’s a three cell build radius and then having it expand by one cell every ten seconds until it hits the max radius.
I can see this having more use outside of MCV range in official and unofficial mods. Radioactive decay and siege-tank mechanics come to mind.

data.title: Fix obelisk targeting.
data.body:
Fixes #12926.

`AttackTesla` (which is the renamed version of the trait the obelisk used to use) was able to drop targets because it indirectly checked reachability via [this check](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Cnc/Traits/Attack/AttackTesla.cs#L94).  We don't want to use the full CanAttack here because that would cancel the target completely thanks to our different chargeup logic.

Only the first commit needs to be cherry picked to prep.

No other actors / traits use AttackOmni, so there is minimal risk of regressions elsewhere.

data.title: Fix crash when master server query returns unexpected data.
data.body:
Fixes #12927.

Testcase: Override `queryURL = "http://www.openra.net;` just before [downloading the server list](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/MultiplayerLogic.cs#L323).

data.title: RA/TD - Add 1 Tile Cliffs by Nooze
data.body:
These should really help to avoid situations like [this](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=300471#300471) and give mapmakers more ability. Also D2K and RA2 for sure and possibly TS has such 1 block cliffs, so why not RA and TD.

Here are some images, some of those may not be really fitting in this shape in some tilesets, so does original tiles, there are some places even some of the original tiles don't fit so didn't really get into that. Those issues are visible on winter and for some reason water desert ones.

Looks like i took some of the SS with pixel doubling some without sorry for that.

data.title: Play game from a specific time from replay
data.body:
From replay go to a specific time in game and convert it to a multiplayer game and play from there again

This could give us the chance to experience a game from another players perspective, alter something in time and replay with possible different results, and have fun

We can call this timeshift

This also gives us the possibility to save and resume multiplayer games

data.title: Resource silos store value instead of amount.
data.body:
In the legacy C&C games, silos always store resource bales instead of refined cash with the resource->conversion happening during the start of the spending.

Related to #12915, because this affects TS economy balance (with blue tib utilizing less storage for the same value).

data.title: [RA] Add/remove official maps 5.
data.body:
**Post-Map Contest (final map PR regarding 6p+ maps).**
- - - - - - - -
**Adding:**
Opposite Force (6 player)
![opposite force](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/23762633/ddbb0cb2-04f6-11e7-9d3f-a7e253bbb4da.png)

Six Below Zero (6 player)
![six below zero](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/23762657/f4a2e4b8-04f6-11e7-8343-2f054ce078be.png)

- - - - - - - -
**Removing:**
Snowy Island (6 player)
![snowy island rew](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/23762676/0c67d7c0-04f7-11e7-8b0f-4a15e0fea8e4.png)

- - - - - - - -
Snowy Island with its middle ground practically belonging to the north has always been a bit sketchy for that reason. Not really balanced nor newbie friendly. Maps Opposite Force and Six Below Zero (both from the map contest) excels in design (one natural, one balanced/mirrored), looks good and fills the void of the long standing Snowy Island.

The 6 and 8player sector is starting to get a bit crowded but I think one more release cycle would be nice too see how they fare against each other in playability and popularity.

Also renamed filename of map Green Belt for consistency sake.

That should be it from me this release cycle.

data.title: HackyAI now builds refinery near ore.
data.body: For some reason AI always placed its refinery near CY. This fix makes it build near ore/tib patch.

data.title: TD Tiberium not harvestable in some games.
data.body:
In some games (perhaps maps) there will be a patch of tiberium that harvesters refuse to pick up.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/j73s2um2yj85kld/OpenRA-2017-03-09T034106Z.orarep?dl=0

Becomes more apparent at 6:00. Watch it at high speed at my base and you will see it. I even tried clicking on it with the harvesters and they go around it. I shot at it with my humvee thinking it was a stealth tank.

I also just noticed harvesters do drive over it.

data.title: Performance issue when searching for target whilst trapped
data.body:
this is easy to reproduce on bleed (and playtest) ... just turn on the performance-graphs ... wall up 50 or more rocket-troopers ... and then target a yak that is out of reach for the troops ... the perf goes nuts

this is essentially a problem when units are walled up ... but also when they are trapped behind mines (with the latest changes in  #12337 )

im making this ticket on behalf of @FrameLimiter who brought the issue up ingame

the "avoid-friendly-mines-mechanic" will cause additional stress on the performance

data.title: Allow selection of Super/Support Powers to trigger launch cursor.
data.body:
Selecting Iron Curtain, Nuke etc. would then allow you to get the 'select target' cursor (when powers are charged). Also enabling players to use control groups for quick and easy customized access.

As of now support power are binded to hotkeys that recognizes the order of support powers top left of the screen.

data.title: Closing a player slot in the lobby ought to trigger an option for spawn point.
data.body:
In case you want to close down specific spawns. A lot of maps has multiple team options with various sizes. Negotiating with players manually through the chat can often be time consuming and it's not always fun 
to order players around verbally.

data.title: Update TD playtest maps
data.body:
This updates Axis of Advance, Order of Battle, and Vectors of Battle with the fixes from @Irnub in #12798.

I have left out Valley of Gold because having 1 fixed variant and 5 unfixed variants is less polished than having a matching set (but would happily include it if we can get the others to match).

data.title: Harvesters can harvest tiberium from inside tunnels.

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body: The harvester logic will need to filter by movement layer.

data.title: [RA] Add/remove official maps 4.
data.body:
**Post-Map Contest (final map PR regarding 2p-4p maps).**
- - - - - - - -
**Adding:**

**Polar Disorder** (2 players)
![polar disorder orig](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/23716650/4c371bb6-0431-11e7-8a72-5745fd7ec39b.png)

**Siberian Pass** (2 players)
![siberian pass orig](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/23716691/697faf08-0431-11e7-9cb7-35b4c3ae0094.png)

One of which came off the 2017 map contest (Polar Disorder), both are looking gorgeous, crisp, should add some distinction to the official 1v1 pool as they seem to harbor _both_ casual and competitive qualities.
- - - - - - - -
**Removing:**

- **Barren Land** (2 players)
- **Arctic Triangle Affair** (3 players)
- **Chokepoint** (4 players)


In hindsight, adding Barren Land with the previous release looks like a mistake. The map functions well competitively, isn't outright _un_popular, but it's visually bland and _very_ newcomer unfriendly due to the far distance between the players. 

Arctic Triangle stayed during the 2016 overhaul solely because of lack of 3 player FFAs. That has changed as we now have _four_ other well functioning 3 player FFA maps.

Chokepoint has a better-looking twin over at 'Bad Neighbors'. Despite its alteration with #10833 it don't really appeal much to anyone, likely has to do with the access points between the spawns which (compared to its big brother, 'Encounter') doesn't invite to much action or fun.
- - - - - - - -
**Alter:**

**Snow Off (2 players)**
![snow off orig](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/23716818/dadf3830-0431-11e7-875a-88592b3508b0.png)

**Vihaan Lunta (4 players)**
![vihaan lunta compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/23716824/e1dca2bc-0431-11e7-8096-643ee18081f7.png)

**Winter Storm (2 players)**
![winter storm compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/23725240/18ba3272-0450-11e7-861e-e4f0871eb97a.png)

Snow Off (added with #12767)being a very small map will have a more rigid presence in the map chooser. A few strokes makes it _slightly_ more crisp (see ridges/debris) so as to fall more in line with its comrades. 

Vihaan Lunta's (added with #12767) spawn points don't look too inviting in the original. 

Winter Storm 2 is the original author's own revision including a blessing allowing the PR author equalizing the same amount of oil derrics as with the first map version. Winter Storm 2 adds visual scenery, a redone eco balance and new paths in and out of the main base.

data.title: Make a civilian structure buildable
data.body:
So im pretty much new to OpenRa. I'm trying to make the Forward Command Post to be buildable for soviets in campaign and in single skrimish, tried changing the civilian.yaml on the rules folder, copying some lines from other soviet structure ,airfield i think, as i wanted it to need a radar first; goes without sating this failed miserably and made the game crash as soon as the MCV is deployed. 

So basically what is the proper procedure to incorporate a structure into a faction and make it buildable?

data.title: Expected behavior for lua api function "Production: Build"?
data.body:
I'm using following code to produce vehicles with a GDI weapons factory:
```
AttackPaths = { { AttackPath1 }, { AttackPath2 } }
VehicleProductionTypes = { "jeep", "mtnk", "msam", "htnk" }
VehicleAttackGroup = { }
VehicleGroupSize = 5
VehicleProductionCooldown = DateTime.Minutes(4)

ProduceVehicle = function(building)
	if building.IsDead then
		return
	end

	local delay = Utils.RandomInteger(DateTime.Seconds(12), DateTime.Seconds(17))
	local toBuild = { Utils.Random(VehicleProductionTypes) }
	local Path = Utils.Random(AttackPaths)
	
	local innerFunc = function(unit)
		VehicleAttackGroup[#VehicleAttackGroup + 1] = unit[1]
		if #VehicleAttackGroup >= VehicleGroupSize then
			SendUnits(VehicleAttackGroup, Path)
			VehicleAttackGroup = { }
			Trigger.AfterDelay(VehicleProductionCooldown, function() ProduceVehicle(building) end)
		else
			Trigger.AfterDelay(delay, function() ProduceVehicle(building) end)
		end
	end

	if not building.Build(toBuild, innerFunc) then
		Trigger.AfterDelay(DateTime.Seconds(2), function() ProduceVehicle(building) end)
	end
end
```
I'm expecting that "**building.Build(toBuild, innerFunc)**" returns false if it attempts to produce a vehicle that has a missing prerequisite: Say a mtnk when the hq got destroyed.

It never appears to return false in such a case and thus the entire production comes to a hold. 

I've seen a similar implementation in gdi04b.

data.title: Mousover tooltip for map names, difficulties and more
data.body:
We have issues with long map names #12595 and difficulties #12844 .
There are other cases, like what kind of map categories and more. 
More uses of tooltip will fix this.

data.title: Fine Tune Cooperative Mode
data.body:
Now days we all love coop,you and your friend vs the world! what a better joy two friends can have in a game.well here is some of my ideas for a prefect coop play.

1) Automatically re join previous server (if the server allows it,this can be a server option).

2) Automatically play mission briefing\info video after mission start\end.

3) Save next\unfinished map in player profile, like in red alert 2 

4) Reload next\unfinished map in the lobby,based on players(user names) currently in the lobby and the game type (coop) like in red alert 2.

5) If not the above, then an in-game save\load ability (and then i woke up)

6) Allow players to watch briefing\info videos in the lobby like in single missions (release-20161019)

7a) Share control for units, buildings, radar, economy, based on the mission layout.

7b) Show player selected actors(units ect) with color indication in the selection square.

7c) OPTIONAL* deny control of player selected actors by coop partner,until they are unselected.

8) Automatically select next mission in the lobby if previous mission was won by the players.

9) Ability to toggle between mission default player colors or player selected colors,in the lobby.

I can't think any thing else that can be added or needed at this point.
Can you imagine how it will be to play a coop game with the above options? that will be a good memory in our gaming lives.

data.title: Master server query parsing should be robust against unexpected input
data.body:
The web request → MiniYaml conversion needs to be wrapped in a try / catch to prevent a crash when public wifi redirects the news post query to a login page:
```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20161019 on map e90c1d4ea07b7cbb048a1057a1b0be4f11ecbe90 (Desert Shellmap by Scott_NZ).
Date: 2016-12-16 09:44:47Z Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0) Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.IO.InvalidDataException`: Duplicate key '<iframe src="http' in <no filename available>:26
Inner Exception of type `System.ArgumentException`: An item with the same k 
```

Reported on IRC.

data.title: TD Obelisk target reset issue.
data.body: When the obelisk locks onto a target but drives out from its firing range it will not target another unit. However if you press S for stop itll start a new target.

data.title: Plug Slot, Health, & Damage State Condition Variables
data.body: This is part of a bigger condition expression framework setup that I'm working on. This adds a plug condition variable to `Pluggable` allowing for generic conditions (`ioncannon`) plus condition variable properties (`pluga.ioncannon`) for plug location specific rendering. The `Pluggable` condition variables can be used for enabling common features (see `tower`). `HealthCondition` and `DamageStateCondition` condition variables as another case of a trait providing condition variables. `GrantConditionOnDamageState` is replaced with `GrantCondition` using `DamageStateCondition` in the rules while `GrantConditionOnDamageState` was converted to `GrantConditionWithSound` as a subclass of `GrantCondition` rule upgrades.  `HealthCondition` will be used with the changes I'm making to the power traits.

data.title: Prevent units in tunnels/underground from attacking

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body: Fixes #12917.

data.title: Unify ingame message prefixes.
data.body: We still have several messages that are by "Server" (e.g. player drop) or by nobody (game paused/unpaused).  These probably should change to "Battlefield Control".

data.title: Selection lost on bridge tiles / impossible to move to bridgehead without attack-move
data.body:
Hi, an issue especially nasty when controlling flimsy units like Yak's:
![grafik](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16046997/23610481/f83b1e3c-0272-11e7-92b8-a7fe73473a6a.png)
When clicking (using left-click orders) the units get deselected. Also is true for ground units. (so without attack move there is NO WAY to position ground units onto the bridgehead)

You would not expect this, since the bridge isn't even selectable. EDIT: ~~This also happens with trees!! This makes using Yaks on maps with lots of trees very hard.~~

If this is fixed I would also propose to make civilian buildings "immune" to clicking, too. (If you want to destroy, you can still force fire there, and hovering the mouse should display the building name)

data.title: Fix TS economy to match original

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
This PR
- fixes refinery storage capacity to match TS
- fixes tib silo storage pip to use green color
- fixes values of green and blue tib to match TS
- fixes harvester load/dump delays to match TS
- fixes harvester to not get slowed down by being loaded to match TS
- limits the number of silos AI can build to 2

**Note1**: The default values for harvester loading and dump rate mentioned on ModEnc don't seem to be correct (or are unused unless the fields are listed in rules.ini), according to my own testing, both harvesting and unloading seems to happen at 15 simulation frames per 'bale' in the original, or 1 second at 15 fps.
**Note2**: Harvesters still harvest faster than in the original, because we're lacking TS' acceleration/decceleration system, which effectively slowed harvesters quite a bit in the original (they never drove at full speed when moving from tiberium patch to tiberium patch, or when approaching/leaving the refinery).
**Note3**: TS had an alternate blue tiberium with identical graphics, but lower value (Aboreus, value 30), that some original maps may actually have used (only seen a tiny bit on Grand Canyon so far, though).
**Note4**: With the huge reduction in tib value and harvest speed, I considered 2 silos more than enough for the AI, it'll probably be completely broke most of the time anyway.

Fixes #12915.
Fixes #12916.
